1.31.23  9:39 am   Hey Bill, are nightmares real, or are they just misunderstood dreams?

1.31.23  7:18 am   here's what i don't get about the theory that "the universe is a simulation"... if our universe is a simulation, that means that there must be a universe that runs this simulation. If there isn't one, and this "simulation" just exists on its own somehow, that would mean the distinction between "real" and "simulation" would be completely arbitrary. so there's another universe that runs this one. but if that's the case, that universe would be the "real" one, and you still run into the same issues that the simulation theory is trying to solve, because how did that universe come into being? is it ALSO a simulation? what about the universe controlling that simulation? you can't just keep going on infinitely, eventually you have to come across the "original" universe. but anyway... what are your thoughts on this

Like, I didn't even notice it was in 3 on my first listen. Do you have any thoughts or insight as to why this might be?

1.29.23  7:01 am   I just failed my regional band audition and I don't know why I always screw these things up because I practice so much and I work so hard and then I get in the room with the judge and it's like my brain short circuits and I just perform horribly and I'm so upset because this was my last year to audition and everyone, including myself, was expecting me to do well but I just totally screwed it up. What's wrong with me? And how do I suck less at auditions? You would think it'd get easier with time, but I've done tons of auditions by now, and they always turn out this way. Like I know I'm a good musician but I can never seem to do a good job of showing it

1.29.23  5:17 am   I've noticed you do a thing sometimes where you delay the resolution of your synth fills so that they only reach the 1 of the scale a while after the bulk of the lick is played.

For example, at 0:32 of im best friends with my own front door, there's a descending recorder thing that ends on the 3 (F#), but then hits the 1 (D) super soft in the left ear at 0:35, a whole bar later.
